name: activedirectory
label: Active Directory
description: Active Directory (AD) is a directory service that Microsoft developed for Windows domain networks. You can directly query AD to retrieve information about users, groups, and computers, in an organization, by using the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) to directly query the AD.

fields.title: Hostname
fields.name: hostname
fields.description: IP address or Hostname of the Active Directory (AD) server.
fields.tooltip: IP address or Hostname of the Active Directory (AD) server.

fields.title: Port
fields.name: port
fields.tooltip: Port 389 used for plain text authentication and port 636 used for SSL authentication
fields.description: Port number used for connecting to the AD server.

fields.title: Username
fields.name: username
fields.description: Valid AD service account with a minimum of read access.
fields.tooltip: Valid AD service account with a minimum of read access.

fields.title: Base DN
fields.name: baseDN
fields.description: The base, or node from where the LDAP search should start. All connector operations are carried out using the Base DN as a root to the AD organization tree. You can restrict the AD lookup by providing appropriate filters in this parameter. Some examples of the same are as follows: DC=cspune,DC=comOU=workstation,DC=cspune,DC=comOU=Develop,OU=workstation,DC=cspune,DC=com
fields.tooltip: The base, or node from where the LDAP search should start. All connector operations are carried out using the Base DN as a root to the AD organization tree. You can restrict the AD lookup by providing appropriate filters in this parameter

fields.title: Bind DN
fields.name: bindDN
fields.description: The fully distinguished name that is used to bind to the LDAP server. Note: If the user specifies a this parameter value, in that case, Bind DN is considered as the username, and the Base DN and username parameters values are ignored for checking health.
fields.tooltip: The fully distinguished name that is used to bind to the LDAP server. Note: If the user specifies a this parameter value, in that case, Bind DN is considered as the username, and the Base DN and username parameters values are ignored for checking health.

fields.title: Use TLS
fields.name: use_tls
fields.tooltip: It is Selected then it use SSL port 636
fields.description: Specifies whether SSL and TLS will be required to establish the connection between the Active Directory connector and the AD server. By default, this option is set as false, and therefore, SSL is used by default.  If selected, uses SSL port 636

operations.title: Add Object
operations.description: Add an object entry of User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU) type in Active Directory based on the type of object and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Object Type
parameters.name: object_class
parameters.description: Type of object whose entry you want to add in Active Directory. You can choose from the following options: User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU). If you choose User, then you must specify the following parameters:User DN: Distinguished name of the user that you want to add in Active Directory. SamAccount Name: sAMAccountName of the user object that you want to add in Active Directory. Display Name: (Optional) Display name of the user object that you want to add in Active Directory. Email Address: (Optional) Email address of the user object that you want to add in Active Directory. Enable User: Select this checkbox, if you want to enable the user object in Active Directory. Clear this checkbox (default) if you want to disable the user object in Active directory. User Principal Name: (Optional) Principal name of the user object that you want to add in Active Directory. Title: (Optional) Title of the user object that you want to add in Active Directory. Description: (Optional) Short description of the user object that you want to add in Active Directory. If you choose Group, then you must specify the following parameters:Group DN: Distinguished name of the group object that you want to add in Active Directory. SamAccount Name: sAMAccountName of the group object that you want to add in Active Directory. Group Type: (Optional) Type of group object you want to add in Active Directory. You can choose from the following options: Global Distribution Group, Domain Local Distribution Group, Universal Distribution Group, Global Security Group, Domain Local Security Group, or Universal Security Group.If you choose Organization Unit, then you must specify the following parameters:Organization DN: Distinguished name of the OU object that you want to add in Active Directory. Description: (Optional) Short description of the OU object who you want to add in Active Directory. If you choose Computer, then you must specify the following parameters:Computer DN: Distinguished name of the computer object that you want to add in Active Directory. SamAccount Name: sAMAccountName of the Compute object that you want to add in Active Directory. Enable Computer: Select this checkbox, if you want to enable the computer object in Active Directory. Clear this checkbox (default) if you want to disable the computer object in Active directory. Display Name: (Optional) Display name of the computer object that you want to add in Active Directory. Description: (Optional) Short description of the computer object that you want to add in Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: Type of object whose entry you want to add in Active Directory. You can choose from the following options: User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU).

User.title: User DN
User.name: object_dn
User.description: Provide distinguished name of the user that you want to add to Active Directory. Note: The "User DN" value should be unique. If an already existing value is provided, it will result in an error indicating that the entry is already present.
User.tooltip: Provide distinguished name of the user that you want to add to Active Directory. Note: The "User DN" value should be unique. If an already existing value is provided, it will result in an error indicating that the entry is already present.

User.title: SamAccount Name
User.name: sAMAccountName
User.description: The sAMAccountName of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory. Note: The sAMAccountName value should be unique. If an already existing value is provided, it will result in an error indicating that the entry is already present.
User.tooltip: The sAMAccountName of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory. Note: The sAMAccountName value should be unique. If an already existing value is provided, it will result in an error indicating that the entry is already present.

User.title: Display Name
User.name: displayName
User.description: Display name of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory
User.tooltip: Display name of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory.

User.title: Email Address
User.name: mail
User.description: Email address of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory.
User.tooltip: Email address of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory.

User.title: Enable User
User.name: enable_account
User.description: Select this option, i.e., select the checkbox, if you want to enabled the user. Clear this option, i.e., Uncheck the checkbox, if you want to disable the user. This is the default value.
User.tooltip: Select this checkbox, if you want to enable the user object in Active Directory. Clear this checkbox (default) if you want to disable the user object in Active Directory

User.title: User Principal Name
User.name: userPrincipalName
User.description: Specify the  user's User Principal Name of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory. Note: "User Principal Name" name means "User logon Name"
User.tooltip: The user's User Principal Name of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory. Note: "User Principal Name" name means "User logon Name"

User.title: Title
User.name: title
User.description: Title of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory. Note: The user's job title in the organization
User.tooltip: Title of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory. Note: The user's job title in the organization

User.title: Description
User.name: description
User.description: Short description of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory
User.tooltip: Short description of the user object that you want to add to Active Directory

Group.title: Group DN
Group.name: object_dn
Group.description: Distinguished name of the group object that you want to add to Active Directory.
Group.tooltip: Distinguished name of the group object that you want to add to Active Directory.

Group.title: SamAccount Name
Group.name: sAMAccountName
Group.description: The sAMAccountName of the group object that you want to add to Active Directory
Group.tooltip: provide the sAMAccountName of the group object that you want to add to Active Directory

Group.title: Group Type
Group.name: GroupType
Group.description: Type of group object you want to add to Active Directory. You can choose from the following options: Global Distribution Group, Domain Local Distribution Group, Universal Distribution Group, Global Security Group, Domain Local Security Group, or Universal Security Group.
Group.tooltip: Type of group object you want to add to Active Directory. You can choose from the following options

Computer.title: Computer DN
Computer.name: object_dn
Computer.description: Distinguished name of the computer object that you want to add to Active Directory
Computer.tooltip: Distinguished name of the computer object that you want to add to Active Directory

Computer.title: SamAccount Name
Computer.name: sAMAccountName
Computer.description: The sAMAccountName of the Compute object that you want to add to Active Directory
Computer.tooltip: The sAMAccountName of the Compute object that you want to add to Active Directory

Computer.title: Enable Computer
Computer.name: enable_account
Computer.description: Select this option, i.e., select the checkbox, if you want to enabled the computer. Clear this option, i.e., Uncheck the checkbox, if you want to disable the user. This is the default value.
Computer.tooltip: Select the checkbox, if you want to enabled the computer.

Computer.title: Description
Computer.name: description
Computer.description: Display name of the computer object that you want to add to Active Directory
Computer.tooltip: Display name of the computer object that you want to add to Active Directory

Organization Unit.title: Organization DN
Organization Unit.name: object_dn
Organization Unit.description: The distinguished name of the OU object that you want to add to Active Directory
Organization Unit.tooltip: Distinguished name of the OU object that you want to add to Active Directory

Organization Unit.title: Description
Organization Unit.name: description
Organization Unit.description: Description for OU object that you want to add to Active Directory
Organization Unit.tooltip: Description for OU object that you want to add to Active Directory

parameters.title: Custom Attributes
parameters.name: custom_attributes
parameters.description: (Optional) Additional fields, in the JSON format, to add in the object that you want to create Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, to add in the object that you want to create Active Directory.

operations.title: Get All Objects Details
operations.description: Searches and retrieves all records from AD based on a specified search object, such as user, computer, or group.

parameters.name: search_object
parameters.title: Object Type
parameters.description: The object type, such as User, Computer, Group, or Person, based on which you want to search and retrieve all records from AD.
parameters.tooltip: The object type, such as User, Computer, Group, or Person, based on which you want to search and retrieve all records from AD.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of record requests that should be included per page. By default, this is set as 0 i.e., no paging. By default, Impact will ask only for one page from the LDAP server. If the LDAP server has a page size set to 1000, then only 1000 records will be returned.
parameters.tooltip: Number of record requests that should be included per page. By default, this is set as 0 i.e., no paging. By default, Impact will ask only for one page from the LDAP server. If the LDAP server has a page size set to 1000, then only 1000 records will be returned.

parameters.title: Size Limit
parameters.name: size_limit
parameters.description: Number of records that should be returned in a single search. When you have enabled paging, i.e., set the Page Size parameter to some value, then this parameter has no effect. However, you must set the value of the Size Limit parameter to less than the value that you have set for Page Size. For example, if you set page size to 100 and size limit to 90, the server will return 90 records. By default, this is set as 0, i.e., none or no limit.
parameters.tooltip: Number of records that should be returned in a single search. When you have enabled paging, i.e., set the Page Size parameter to some value, then this parameter has no effect. However, you must set the value of the Size Limit parameter to less than the value that you have set for Page Size. For example, if you set page size to 100 and size limit to 90, the server will return 90 records. By default, this is set as 0, i.e., none or no limit.

parameters.title: Paged Cookie
parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: (Optional) Value of an Opaque string, which if received in a paged search must be sent back while requesting subsequent entries of the search result.
parameters.tooltip: Value of an Opaque string, which if received in a paged search must be sent back while requesting subsequent entries of the search result.

operations.title: Get Specific Object Details
operations.description: Searches and retrieves records from AD based on a specified search object, such as user, computer, or group. However, this search is limited to the records found for the object name you have specified. For example, if you want to retrieve the records from AD for a specific user, you need to specify the name of the user.

parameters.name: search_object
parameters.title: Object Type
parameters.description: The object type, such as User, Computer, Group, or Person, based on which you want to search and retrieve records from AD. If you select the Object Type as Person then you must also add the inputs for the CN and SN parameters.
parameters.tooltip: Select the object type, such as User, Computer, Group, or Person, based on which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.

User.title: SamAccount Name
User.name: search_attr_value
User.tooltip: The value of the sAMAccountName which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.
User.description: The value of the sAMAccountName which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.

Computer.title: SamAccount Name
Computer.name: search_attr_value
Computer.tooltip: The value of the sAMAccountName which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.
Computer.description: The value of the sAMAccountName which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.

Group.title: SamAccount Name
Group.name: search_attr_value
Group.tooltip: The value of the sAMAccountName which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.
Group.description: The value of the sAMAccountName which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.

Person.title: CN
Person.name: cn
Person.description: Common name of the Person you want to search and retrieve records from AD.
Person.tooltip: Common name of the Person you want to search and retrieve records from AD.

Person.title: SN
Person.name: sn
Person.tooltip: Surname of the Person you want to search and retrieve records from AD.
Person.description: Surname of the Person you want to search and retrieve records from AD.

operations.title: Update Object
operations.description: Updates an existing object entry of User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU) type in Active Directory based on the type of object and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Object Type
parameters.name: object_class
parameters.description: Type of object whose entry you want to update in Active Directory. You can choose from the following options: User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU). If you choose User, then you must specify the following parameters:User DN: Distinguished name of the user that you want to update in Active Directory. SamAccount Name: (Optional) sAMAccountName of the user object that you want to update in Active Directory. Display Name: (Optional) Display name of the user object that you want to update in Active Directory. Email Address: (Optional) Email address of the user object that you want to update in Active Directory. Enable User: Select this checkbox, if you want to enable the user object in Active Directory. Clear this checkbox (default) if you want to disable the user object in Active directory. User Principal Name: (Optional) Principal name of the user object that you want to update in Active Directory. Title: (Optional) Title of the user object that you want to update in Active Directory. Description: (Optional) Short description of the user object that you want to update in Active Directory. If you choose Group, then you must specify the following parameters:Group DN: Distinguished name of the group object that you want to update in Active Directory. SamAccount Name: sAMAccountName of the group object that you want to update in Active Directory. Group Type: (Optional) Type of group object you want to update in Active Directory. You can choose from the following options: Global Distribution Group, Domain Local Distribution Group, Universal Distribution Group, Global Security Group, Domain Local Security Group, or Universal Security Group. If you choose Organization Unit, then you must specify the following parameters:Organization DN: Distinguished name of the OU object that you want to update in Active Directory. Description: (Optional) Short description of the OU object who you want to update in Active Directory. If you choose Computer, then you must specify the following parameters:Computer DN: Distinguished name of the computer object that you want to update in Active Directory. SamAccount Name: sAMAccountName of the Compute object that you want to update in Active Directory. Enable Computer: Select this checkbox, if you want to enable the computer object in Active Directory. Clear this checkbox (default) if you want to disable the computer object in Active directory. Display Name: (Optional) Display name of the computer object that you want to update in Active Directory. Description: (Optional) Short description of the computer object that you want to update in Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: Type of object whose entry you want to update in Active Directory. You can choose from the following options: User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU)

User.description: Provide distinguished name of the user object which you want to update, this field used only search record in Active Directory, This is not update

operations.description: Move a computer entry from one Organization Unit(OU) to another.

operations.title: Delete Object
operations.description: Deletes an existing object entry of User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU) type from Active Directory based on the type of object and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Object Type
parameters.name: object_class
parameters.description: Type of object whose entry you want to delete from Active Directory. You can choose from the following options: User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU). Based on the type of object that you choose you must specify the following parameters: Attributes Type: If you choose User, then from the Attributes Type drop-down list, you can choose Distinguished Name, SamAccount Name or Email of the user object that you want to delete from Active Directory. If you choose Group, then from the Attributes Type drop-down list, you can choose Distinguished Name or SamAccount Name of the computer object that you want to delete from Active Directory. If you choose Computer, then from the Attributes Type drop-down list, you can choose Distinguished Name or SamAccount Name of the computer object that you want to delete from Active Directory. If you choose Organization Unit, then you have to specify the Distinguished Name of the OU object that you want to delete from Active Directory. Value: Value of the attribute type you have choosen.
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of object whose entry you want to delete from Active Directory. You can choose from the following options: User, Group, Computer or Organization Unit (OU).

User.name: search_attr_name
User.title: Attributes Type
User.description: Select attribute, either the Distinguished Name, SamAccount Name or Email of the user object, based on which you want to delete form Active Directory
User.tooltip: Select attribute, either the Distinguished Name, SamAccount Name or Email of the user object, based on which you want to delete form Active Directory

User.title: Value
User.name: search_attr_value
User.description: The value of for selected attributes types
User.tooltip: The value of for selected attributes types

Computer.title: Attributes Type
Computer.description: The attribute, either the Distinguished Name or SamAccount Name of the computer object, based on which you want to delete form Active Directory
Computer.tooltip: The attribute, either the Distinguished Name or SamAccount Name of the object, based on which you want to delete a object form Active Directory

operations.title: Add Group Members
operations.description: Adds an Active Directory User or Computer as a member to an existing Group in Active Directory based on the Group DN and User or computer DN you have specified.

parameters.title: Group DN
parameters.name: group_dn
parameters.description: List of Distinguished Names of the group in Active Directory to which you want to add members. Note: You must enter DN values in the list format.
parameters.tooltip: Provide list of Distinguished Names of the group in Active Directory to which you want to add members. Note: You must enter DN values in the list format.

parameters.title: Object Type
parameters.name: object_class
parameters.description: Type of object, User or Computer, that you want to add as members to the specified group in Active Directory. If you choose Computer, then you must specify the following parameter:Computer DN: List of Distinguished Name of the computer object that you want to add as a member to a group in Active Directory. If you choose User, then you must specify the following parameter:User DN: List of Distinguished Name of the user object that you want to add as a member to a group in Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: Select the object type, User, or Computer, that you want to add as members to the specified group in Active Directory.

User.title: User DN
User.name: object_dn
User.description: Provide list of distinguished name of the users to add members into group, Note: DN values should be in List format
User.tooltip: Provide distinguished name of the users to add members into group, Note: DN values should be in List format

Computer.title: Computer DN
Computer.name: object_dn
Computer.description: Provide list of distinguished name of the computer to add member into group, Note: DN values should be in List format
Computer.tooltip: Provide list of distinguished name of the computers to add member into group, Note: DN values should be in List format

operations.title: Remove Group Members
operations.description: Removes an Active Directory User or Computer as a member from an existing Group in Active Directory based on the Group DN and User or computer DN you have specified.

parameters.title: Group DN
parameters.name: group_dn
parameters.description: List of Distinguished Names of the group in Active Directory from which you want to remove members. Note: You must enter DN values in the list format.
parameters.tooltip: Provide list of Distinguished Names of the group in Active Directory from which you want to remove members. Note: You must enter DN values in the list format.

parameters.title: Object Type
parameters.name: object_class
parameters.description: Type of object, User or Computer, that you want to remove as members from the specified group in Active Directory. If you choose Computer, then you must specify the following parameter: Computer DN: List of Distinguished Name of the computer object that you want to remove as a member from a group in Active Directory. If you choose User, then you must specify the following parameter: User DN: List of Distinguished Name of the user object that you want to remove as a member from a group in Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of object, User or Computer, that you want to remove as members from the specified group in Active Directory

User.title: User DN
User.name: object_dn
User.description: Provide list of distinguished name of the users to remove from groups, Note: DN values should be in List format
User.tooltip: Provide list of distinguished name of the users to remove from groups, Note: DN values should be in List format

Computer.name: object_dn
Computer.description: Provide list of distinguished name of the computer to remove from group, Note: DN values should be in List format
Computer.tooltip: Provide list of distinguished name of the computer to remove from group, Note: DN values should be in List format

operations.title: Advanced Search
operations.description: Executes an advanced LDAP query that searches and retrieves AD records based on your custom query.

parameters.title: LDAP Query
parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The custom LDAP query based on which you want to retrieve records from AD.
parameters.tooltip: Search Active Directory records using custom query

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of record requests that should be included per page. By default, this is set as 0 i.e., no paging. By default, Impact will ask only for one page from the LDAP server. If the LDAP server has a page size set to 1000, then only 1000 records will be returned.
parameters.tooltip: This parameter specifies the number of records requests per page. The default is 0 (no paging). By default, Impact will only ask for one page from the LDAP server. If the LDAP server has a page size set to 1000, then only 1000 records will be returned.

parameters.title: Size Limit
parameters.name: size_limit
parameters.description: Number of records that should be returned in a single search. When you have enabled paging, i.e., set the Page Size parameter to some value, then this parameter has no effect. However, you must set the value of the Size Limit parameter to less than the value that you have set for Page Size. For example, if you set page size to 100 and size limit to 90, the server will return 90 records. By default, this is set as 0, i.e., none or no limit.
parameters.tooltip: Number of records that should be returned in a single search. When you have enabled paging, i.e., set the Page Size parameter to some value, then this parameter has no effect. However, you must set the value of the Size Limit parameter to less than the value that you have set for Page Size. For example, if you set page size to 100 and size limit to 90, the server will return 90 records. By default, this is set as 0, i.e., none or no limit.

parameters.title: Paged Cookie
parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: (Optional) Value of an Opaque string, which if received in a paged search must be sent back while requesting subsequent entries of the search result.
parameters.tooltip: Value of an Opaque string, which if received in a paged search must be sent back while requesting subsequent entries of the search result.

operations.title: Global Search
operations.description: Searches and retrieves records from AD using global search, based on the specified search object, such as user, computer, group, search attribute, or a search attribute value, such as SamAccount Name, Distinguished Name, Common Name, Display Name, or Email. When you search a record based on a search attribute value, the record from AD is retrieved based on the specified attribute value.

parameters.title: Object Type
parameters.name: search_object
parameters.description: The object type, such as User, Computer, Group, or Person, based on which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.
parameters.tooltip: The object type, such as User, Computer, Group, or Person, based on which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.

parameters.title: Attributes Type
parameters.name: search_attr_name
parameters.description: The attribute type, such as SamAccount Name, DistinguishedName, Common Name, Display Name, or Email, based on which you want to search and retrieve records from AD
parameters.tooltip: Select the attribute type, such as SamAccount Name, DistinguishedName, Common Name, Display Name, or Email, based on which you want to search and retrieve records from AD

parameters.title: Value
parameters.name: search_attr_value
parameters.description: The attribute value based on which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.
parameters.tooltip: The attribute value based on which you want to search and retrieve records from AD.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of record requests that should be included per page. By default, this is set as 0 i.e., no paging. By default, Impact will ask only for one page from the LDAP server. If the LDAP server has a page size set to 1000, then only 1000 records will be returned.
parameters.tooltip: Number of record requests that should be included per page. By default, this is set as 0 i.e., no paging. By default, Impact will ask only for one page from the LDAP server. If the LDAP server has a page size set to 1000, then only 1000 records will be returned.

parameters.title: Size Limit
parameters.name: size_limit
parameters.description: Number of records that should be returned in a single search. When you have enabled paging, i.e., set the Page Size parameter to some value, then this parameter has no effect. However, you must set the value of the Size Limit parameter to less than the value that you have set for Page Size. For example, if you set page size to 100 and size limit to 90, the server will return 90 records. By default, this is set as 0, i.e., none or no limit.
parameters.tooltip: Number of records that should be returned in a single search. When you have enabled paging, i.e., set the Page Size parameter to some value, then this parameter has no effect. However, you must set the value of the Size Limit parameter to less than the value that you have set for Page Size. For example, if you set page size to 100 and size limit to 90, the server will return 90 records. By default, this is set as 0, i.e., none or no limit.

parameters.title: Paged Cookie
parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: (Optional) Value of an Opaque string, which if received in a paged search must be sent back while requesting subsequent entries of the search result.
parameters.tooltip: Value of an Opaque string, which if received in a paged search must be sent back while requesting subsequent entries of the search result.

operations.title: Enable User Account
operations.description: Enables the account of a specific AD user based on the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user.

parameters.name: search_attr_name
parameters.title: Attributes Type
parameters.description: The attribute, either the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to enable a user account in AD.
parameters.tooltip: The attribute, either the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to enable a user account in AD.

parameters.title: Value
parameters.name: search_attr_value
parameters.description: The value of the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to enable a user account in AD.
parameters.tooltip: The value of the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to enable a user account in AD.

operations.title: Disable User Account
operations.description: Disables the account of a specific AD user based on the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user.

parameters.name: search_attr_name
parameters.title: Attributes Type
parameters.description: The value of the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to disable a user account in AD.
parameters.tooltip: The value of the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to disable a user account in AD.

parameters.title: Value
parameters.name: search_attr_value
parameters.description: The value of the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to disable a user account in AD.
parameters.tooltip: The value of the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to disable a user account in AD.

operations.title: Move User to Targeted Organization Unit(OU)
operations.description: Moves the account of a specific AD user based on the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user to a new Organization Unit

parameters.title: Attributes Type
parameters.name: search_attr_name
parameters.description: Select the value of the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to move a user account in AD.
parameters.tooltip: Select the value of the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to move a user account in AD.

parameters.title: Value
parameters.name: search_attr_value
parameters.tooltip: Specify the value of the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user, based on which you want to move a user account in a new Organisational Unit
parameters.description: Specify the value of either the SamAccount Name or the Email of the user based on your preference to move a user account in a new Organisational Unit

parameters.title: Destination OU
parameters.name: destinationOU
parameters.description: Specify the value of the targeted new Organizational Unit to which you want to move the user
parameters.tooltip: Specify the value of the targeted new Organizational Unit to which you want to move the user

operations.title: Enable Computer
operations.description: Enables the specific computer account based on the Distinguished Name or SamAccount Name of the computer you have specified.

parameters.name: search_attr_name
parameters.title: Attributes Type
parameters.description: The attribute, either the Distinguished Names (DN) or the SamAccount Name of the computer using which you want to enable the computer account in Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: The attribute, either the Distinguished Names (DN) or the SamAccount Name of the computer using which you want to enable the computer account in Active Directory.

parameters.title: Value
parameters.name: search_attr_value
parameters.description: The value of the Distinguished Names(DN) or the SamAccount Name of the computer account that you want to enable in Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: The value of the Distinguished Names(DN) or the SamAccount Name of the computer account that you want to enable in Active Directory.

operations.title: Disable Computer
operations.description: Disables the computer account based on the Distinguished Name or SamAccount Name of the computer you have specified.

parameters.name: search_attr_name
parameters.title: Attributes Type
parameters.description: The attribute, either the Distinguished Names (DN) or the SamAccount Name of the computer using which you want to disable the computer account in Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: The attribute, either the Distinguished Names (DN) or the SamAccount Name of the computer using which you want to disable the computer account in Active Directory.

parameters.title: Value
parameters.name: search_attr_value
parameters.description: The value of the Distinguished Names(DN) or the SamAccount Name of the computer account that you want to disable in Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: The value of the Distinguished Names(DN) or the SamAccount Name of the computer account that you want to disable in Active Directory.

operations.title: Reset Password
operations.description: Resets the password for a specific AD user based on the SamAccount Name or the Email, or the Distinguished Name (DN) of the user.

parameters.name: search_attr_name
parameters.title: Attributes Type
parameters.tooltip: The attribute, either the SamAccount Name, Distinguished Name, or the Email of the user, whose password you want to reset in AD.
parameters.description: The attribute, either the SamAccount Name, Distinguished Name, or the Email of the user, whose password you want to reset in AD.

parameters.title: Attributes Value
parameters.name: search_attr_value
parameters.description: The value of the SamAccount Name, the Distinguished Name, or the Email of the user, whose password you want to reset in AD.
parameters.tooltip: The value of the SamAccount Name, the Distinguished Name, or the Email of the user, whose password you want to reset in AD.

parameters.title: New Password
parameters.name: new_password
parameters.tooltip: The password should meet the password policy requirements. Check the minimum password length, password complexity and password history requirements
parameters.description: The password that you want to set for the specific user. The new password must meet the password policy requirements. For password policy requirements and the minimum password length, password complexity, and password history requirements, see https://www.grouppolicy.biz/2011/08/tutorial-how-to-setup-default-and-fine-grain-password-policy/.

operations.title: Force password reset on next logon
operations.description: Forces specific Active Directory users to reset their password when they next log on to Active Directory. You can specify the user who requires to reset their password based on the SamAccount Name, Email, or Distinguished Name (DN) of the user.

parameters.name: search_attr_name
parameters.title: Attributes Type
parameters.tooltip: The attribute, either the Distinguished Name (DN), email address, or SamAccount Name of the user who requires to reset their password when they next log on to Active Directory.
parameters.description: The attribute, either the Distinguished Name (DN), email address, or SamAccount Name of the user who requires to reset their password when they next log on to Active Directory.

parameters.title: Attributes Value
parameters.name: search_attr_value
parameters.tooltip: The value of the Distinguished Name (DN), email address, or SamAccount Name of the user who requires to reset their password when they next log on to Active Directory.
parameters.description: The value of the Distinguished Name (DN), email address, or SamAccount Name of the user who requires to reset their password when they next log on to Active Directory.
